  • Method Details

    • onActionAddPart

      public void onActionAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Displays the program's 'Add Part' page RUNTIME ERROR: The program would load an incorrectly sized window for the following screen. This was fixed by specifying the size of the newScene in its instantiation.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent that initiates the method, in this case clicking the 'Add Part' button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling .load() on the FXMLLoader object to generate the newScene

    • onActionModifyPart

      public void onActionModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Displays the 'Modify Part' page for the Part that is selected in the partTableView. Sending the selected Part object to the ModifyPart controller requires the ModifyPart controller's public method, sendPart(). If no Part is selected an error is thrown. RUNTIME ERROR: Initially the sendPart() method was private and could not be called for in this controller. This was fixed by making the sendPart() method public.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent that initiates the method, in this case clicking the 'Modify Part' button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling .load() on the FXMLLoader object to generate the newScene

    • onActionDeletePart

      public void onActionDeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deletes the selected part in the partTableView from Inventory. The program prompts the user for confirmation before deletion. If no part is selected an error is thrown. RUNTIME ERROR: Initially the nested if-else statements would not function correctly because of misplaced curly braces. This was fixed by correctly placing curly braces.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent that initiates the method, in this case clicking the 'Delete Part' button

    • onPartSearchClick

      public void onPartSearchClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Clears the text in the TextField when the TextField is clicked.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - Clicking inside the TextField

    • onPartKeyRelease

      public void onPartKeyRelease(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Searches all Parts in Inventory for the inputted Part Name or Part Id after each keystroke. If no results are found all Part objects are displayed in the TableView. RUNTIME ERROR: Initially the selected Part would not be visible in the TableView unless that section of the TableView was already in view. This was fixed by implementing the .scrollTo() method.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - a keystroke while typing in the partTableView search bar

    • onPartSearch

      public void onPartSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Searches all Parts in Inventory for the inputted Part Name or Part Id. If no results are found all Part objects are displayed in the TableView. RUNTIME ERROR: Initially the selected Part would not be visible in the TableView unless that section of the TableView was already in view. This was fixed by implementing the .scrollTo() method.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - pressing enter/return after typing in the TextField

    • onActionAddProduct

      public void onActionAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Displays the program's 'Add Product' page RUNTIME ERROR: The program would load an incorrectly sized window for the following screen. This was fixed by specifying the size of the newScene in its instantiation.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent that initiates the method, in this case clicking the 'Add Product' button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling .load() on the FXMLLoader object to generate the newScene

    • onActionModifyProduct

      public void onActionModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Displays the 'Modify Product' page for the Product that is selected in the productTableView. Sending the selected product object to the ModifyProduct controller requires the ModifyProduct controller's public method sendProduct(). If no Product is selected an error is thrown. RUNTIME ERROR: Initially the sendProduct() method was private and could not be called for in this controller. This was fixed by making the sendProduct() method public.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent that initiates the method, in this case clicking the 'Modify Product' button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling .load() on the FXMLLoader object to generate the newScene

    • onActionDeleteProduct

      public void onActionDeleteProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deletes the selected Product in the productTableView from Inventory. The program prompts the user for confirmation before deletion. If no product is selected an error is thrown. RUNTIME ERROR: Initially the nested if-else statements would not function correctly because of misplaced curly braces. This was fixed by correctly placing curly braces.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent that initiates the method, in this case clicking the 'Delete Product' button

    • onProductSearchClick

      public void onProductSearchClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Clears the text in the TextField when the TextField is clicked.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - Clicking inside the TextField

    • onProductKeyRelease

      public void onProductKeyRelease(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Searches all Products in Inventory for the inputted Product Name or Product Id after each keystroke. If no results are found all Product objects are displayed in the TableView. RUNTIME ERROR: Initially the selected Product would not be visible in the TableView unless that section of the TableView was already in view. This was fixed by implementing the .scrollTo() method.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - a keystroke while typing in the productTableView search bar

    • onProductSearch

      public void onProductSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Searches all Products in Inventory for the inputted Product Name or Product Id after each keystroke. If no results are found all Product objects are displayed in the TableView. RUNTIME ERROR: Initially the selected Product would not be visible in the TableView unless that section of the TableView was already in view. This was fixed by implementing the .scrollTo() method.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - pressing enter/return after typing in the TextField

    • onActionExit

      public void onActionExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Exits the application.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - clicking on the 'Exit' button
